website_summaries.verdict: Safety tested and crash test certified combined with an extra large design.
pros: USA crash tested and safety certified
Solidly constructed and requires no pieces to be put together at all
Comes with a lifetime warranty and a 100% satisfaction guarantee
A portion of all of the profits go to mother and child charities
cons: Because it requires an adjustable headrests for proper installation it isn't perfect for all car seats

customer_reviews.title: Love this one. This DaffaDoot brand turned out to be a winner.
customer_reviews.text: Excellent. This is the one to get. Was so tired of ready all the reviews on 60 million other mirrors. Everyone says theirs is the best. Tried Cozy Green and it was awful as both kept shaking making it impossible to view baby. Worthless. This one was indeed easy to install and stays put. No vibrating and is very large. I can pivot it extensively as it is placed in the rear side headrest to view my baby in the center. So far I love it.
customer_reviews.author: Kitty14us

customer_reviews.title: Super easy to install and worth the extra bucks to ...
customer_reviews.text: I have bought several Mirrors and been disapppointed in the quality or their “sticking power”. This mirror is high quality with no distortions from my rear view mirror and it’s so much bigger than most car seat mirrors so even if i accidentally bump it, I can usually still see my little ones without a problem. Super easy to install and worth the extra bucks to get this one-it will last you a long time and is way better than most car seat mirrors out on the market.
customer_reviews.author: ssk463

customer_reviews.title: Looking back has never been so easy...
customer_reviews.text: Just what I was looking for in a back seat mirror. Easy to assembly it does not slide around at all, the mirror has four straps that buckle in the back which are adjustable. The mirror itself is a good size, its not too large where it can become a distraction while driving but it is easy to see my little one in great detail. I would recommend this product to any parent. Please click YES if this was helpful :)
customer_reviews.author: M.Mae.

customer_reviews.title: Well-made, great size, easy to adjust
customer_reviews.text: We've had this mirror for a year now, and still love it. It's a great size-- a lot bigger than some out on the market, but still relatively low profile when installed against a head rest. I did have to install the base upside down because of the angle and height of the headrests in our Honda, but it still works as expected. The only drawback is that it's easy to bump when putting a child in a rear-facing car seat so that it has to be readjusted-- an easy thing to do, though.
customer_reviews.author: NEfarmgirl

customer_reviews.title: Great car mirror
customer_reviews.text: This was easy to install and stays put. It’s also easy to position the mirror in the right spot. I can see my baby well from the rear view mirror. The mirror is convex so that you can see your baby and baby’s surroundings, which is nice. I don’t know that baby can really see herself though.
customer_reviews.author: Romoca

customer_reviews.title: Perfect baby mirror, couldn't ask for more
customer_reviews.text: We got this to replace ours that was accidentally left in our totaled car after a minor accident. It's super clear, almost to the point of being messing-with-your-mind creepy, and incredibly easy to switch from one side of the car to the other. The swivel joint makes it easy to get in the exact position you want it to. Seems durable and cleans up well too. Overall, perfect baby mirror and miles better than the baby shower gifted one we lost. Just buy it, you won't regret it.
customer_reviews.author: Evan H

customer_reviews.title: Good quality reflection, easy to mount and adjust.
customer_reviews.text: The mirror attaches easily and is easy to adjust after it's mounted. The fit is a little weird on the headrest in my car because the headrest is rather curved, but the mirror attaches securely. The only thing that bothered me a bit was that the vertical strap will only stay kind of tight... if I pull it more tight, it just slides back to where it wants to be. This is ok in my situation because the horizontal strap stays very snug, and the vertical is snug enough. Aside from being able to adjust the mirror after it's mounted, my favorite thing is that it came with a protective sheet over the mirror, so the mirror condition was excellent.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: How much can you love a mirror? More than I thought!
customer_reviews.text: This is a great mirror. I purchased it for my husband's car (Nissan Xterra) which doesn't have a middle headrest. It was easy to install on the side headrest (1 min) and angled in 30 seconds for a perfect view of baby from the driver's side. Now I have mirror envy! The mirror is much clearer and higher quality than a standard baby mirror. Not only can we see our precious cargo with stunning clarity, he really seems to enjoy admiring himself! And anything that keeps baby happy during long car rides is a bonus! I don't have anything bad to say other than beware of mirror envy. I may be buying a second one soon!
customer_reviews.author: Allison Harris

customer_reviews.title: Easy to install and gives peace of mind. Get one per car!
customer_reviews.text: Backseat mirror is an absolute necessity imo. This one was easy to install and adjust. Haven't had to adjust it since first putting it in. I just love being able to see what's going on in the back seat from my rearview mirror or just turning around and looking at the mirror if I'm in the passenger seat. Wish I had gotten 2 to take advantage of the discount with multiple purchases and have one to put in my husband's car.
customer_reviews.author: RachelTop Contributor: Baby

customer_reviews.title: The best baby mirror we've found!
customer_reviews.text: When I bought this mirror and saw all the good reviews, I was sure that the company must pay people to review it! If so, I'm ready for my paycheck! Seriously, though, this is a great mirror. It's the perfect size to see what baby is up to! It adjusts easily but then doesn't flop around. It has straps that go both ways around the headrest to keep it extra secure (this was something I was super paranoid about!). We have used it on both the middle and the side seats in our Outback without any issue! I've had multiple friends with babies ask where we got it, and I'm very happy to recommend it to them!
customer_reviews.author: MB49

customer_reviews.title: I can't imagine driving without it.
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love this product. I cannot imagine driving without it. I have to make sure that I can see my baby while I am driving. It helped me even once notice that baby neck was hanging on the side while in the car seat. On the end, I had to get a better infant car seat. So, thanks to this mirror to keep close eye on my baby boy. This product is of a great quality, stays still attached and baby enjoys looking at himself in the mirror, too-:). I even recommended this product to few friends. Great deal and you won't regret getting it.
customer_reviews.author: Mely

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: I have bought 4 mirrors for my rear facing car seats. None of them compare to this one. First off it holds still and doesn't move around. The straps keep it secure and the "pivot" feature on it also holds its position. Second its huge! I drive a giant passenger van and this mirror allows me to actually see my kiddo two rows back.
customer_reviews.author: Ricci

customer_reviews.title: I loved it because I can finally see my baby while ...
customer_reviews.text: When I first installed this and started to drive around with it, I loved it because I can finally see my baby while I drive. However, each time my car went over some type of a bump, even a slight one, the straps got loose and the mirror started to drop lower and lower. The straps just won't stay tightened unless you tie them up somehow. Disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Amy

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't move on a bumpy road.
customer_reviews.text: I initially bought a Britax mirror and after it broke I looked into this one and wish I had it from the beginning. It's a large mirror and when you turn it in place it doesn't fall down as you're going down the road, even on a bumpy dirt road! It snaps on well. It is hard to use without a detachable or adjustable head rest but you can improvise. I cannot imagine driving without one of these for a rear facing car seat. Bring peace of mind for sure!
customer_reviews.author: Ali Mae

customer_reviews.title: These mirrors are wonderful. I had originally bought a flat baby mirror ...
customer_reviews.text: These mirrors are wonderful. I had originally bought a flat baby mirror from a local baby store, but I couldn't get it to stay on the headrest or get the angle right so I could see my baby. My sister recommended the DaffaDoot, and they work perfectly. They fit on the oddly shaped headrest in my husband's car, and I can adjust them for the exact angle that I want. It was money well spent.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin & Bekah G.

customer_reviews.title: Great purchase
customer_reviews.text: Awesome product. Tried one of these mirrors (not this brand) with our 1st son, Did. Not. Work. Was skeptical ordering this one but very pleased with results. Mirror is sturdy but flexible. Easily adjustable. Perfect size to see baby from rear view mirror. Fit over back seat headrest. Not plastic-y material that makes baby look distorted. Overall could t be happier. Had product for about a week so can't say long term but very happy with purchas & would definitely recommend. Company also sent email with tips, just one email, which I found helpful.
customer_reviews.author: BelF

customer_reviews.title: ) BUT it' super effective - I can always see my daughter clearly ...
customer_reviews.text: After struggling with another, much cheaper, mirror for one year, I decided to give this one a go even though its quite expensive compared to the others out there. It's ridiculously big and a lot of people think it;s a TV in the back of our car :) BUT it' super effective - I can always see my daughter clearly now and I am not constantly adjusting the mirror every time I get in the car. This one stays in place and is clear and very helpful.
customer_reviews.author: Nadia G

customer_reviews.title: Worth 10 stars!
customer_reviews.text: I had previously purchased two different mirrors that if touched, would require a great amount of adjustment and fiddling to get back to where you need them. I finally decided to search for a better mirror, and this was the winner. This was such a great mirror, I ordered a second for my other baby. The mirror stays in place, and if you bump it out of place, you can move it right back. The only thing is that sometimes it jiggles just a bit while driving down the road, and that can take a little while to get used to. Wonderful mirror, if I could give it 10 stars I would.
customer_reviews.author: smf199

customer_reviews.title: Mirror is ok but I've had better.
customer_reviews.text: My only problem with this mirror is I feel the magnification could be bigger. It's really difficult for me to see my baby in the rear view mirror. Got to remove my sunglasses and squint because she looks so small but I can see everything else around her. I had a better mirror for my older daughter but it broke. Wish I could find that brand again.
customer_reviews.author: April Biederman

customer_reviews.title: The 2 belts and the pivoting feature is great on his mirror
customer_reviews.text: The 2 belts and the pivoting feature is great on his mirror. I have it on lengthwise, so I can see better what my little one is doing, and it's very convenient. Now my 2 year old entertains herself in it as well while we drive. I've had this for over a year and I like it more the other mirrors specifically because it pivots so easily and let's you adjust the best angle to allow the driver to see the little one.
customer_reviews.author: Lelek

customer_reviews.title: Great back seat mirror!
customer_reviews.text: This is great! I had found a couple of other mirrors to put on our baby registries but when no one got them for us, I went to Amazon and saw that those ones had horrible reviews. So of course I went looking for what was the best reviewed mirror and here I am! I ordered this one and though it took me a minute to install it correctly (it was a little challenging in my car to tighten it well), I love it! And unlike my husband's mirror, it doesn't move super easily when getting the car seat in and out of the car! I definitely recommend it :)
customer_reviews.author: J. Sims

customer_reviews.title: Best spent money!!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: I could seriously go on and on about how amazing this mirror is! I've gotten every mom I know to buy them and chuck the crap ones they already had! This mirror sits on a ball and socket type joint so you can turn it the perfect direction and no matter how many pot holes you hit it will not budge! I have 4 of these and when I'm done needing a mirror I know I can easily sell them on the tagsale sites for $10 a mirror.
customer_reviews.author: danielle sav

customer_reviews.title: Straps Suddenly Broke
customer_reviews.text: I bought two mirrors, and they both have had the straps fray and break out of nowhere. The first mirror lasted a little over a year and the second one only lasted a few months. I loved these mirrors because they were easy to install and provided a great way to keep an eye on my son, however, it is very concerning that the straps suddenly frayed and broke. The second one broke while I was driving with my son in the car. I hate to think what would have happened if we had gotten in an accident and the straps would have failed like they did.
customer_reviews.author: kahe

customer_reviews.title: No Warped Effect
customer_reviews.text: Other baby mirrors have some magnification, giving a warped, fun house effect that I didn't like. DaffaDoot is a true 1:1 mirror that can be customized for your car's headrest. I like that it's so large because it makes glancing at my baby from the rear view very quick. I found myself squinting or focusing too long on my rear view mirror with the other baby mirrors I've purchased.
customer_reviews.author: Christine L.

customer_reviews.title: Works even with Fixed Headrest
customer_reviews.text: LOVE this mirror. I never leave reviews but --cI searched long and hard for a mirror that would stay in place with my fixed headrest. I wasn't sure this one would, but it does! I tied the vertical strap to the car seat anchor clip located behind he headrest, and hooked the horizontal strap around the headrest. But the best part is probably the toggle ball on the back that adjusts the angle and keeps it securely where you want it. The big size makes it so easy to see my baby's face from both the driver and passenger seat. 5 stars for sure.
customer_reviews.author: MoscowMouse

customer_reviews.title: Best mirror in the market! Am able to quickly see my baby safely and clearly!
customer_reviews.text: When your driving and want to make sure your little one you dont want to squint or look for too long. This is why i hated the previous mirror i bought. But this one one quick glance and you can safely check the your little one is ok! So glad i got this!
customer_reviews.author: Tina

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use and the reflection is the best
customer_reviews.text: When I started looking for a baby car mirror, I was so surprised how ugly the reflection the most of the baby mirrors make. I understand, it's the safety and it has to be plastic (not a real mirror) but come on, the most are really aweful. The ScooterBugg is totally a different story - the reflection looks totally real! The installation is very very simple and feels very secure. I love this mirror. I really believe it's the best one out there and totally recommend to everyone.
customer_reviews.author: Lena

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: Love this mirror! We used to have the Brica mirror and couldn't see well, and it wasn't very adjustable. This is big, clear, and easily adjustable. We can mount it to the seat next to where the car seat is installed (if crash impact is a concern), and the car seat is still visible. Only gripe is the strap material is a bit slick, so it doesn't stay put well on some headrest styles (like a Honda Accord). Works great in a Kia Sedona.
customer_reviews.author: KatieNS

customer_reviews.title: Love this mirror
customer_reviews.text: Love this mirror!!! The 2 straps make it stay nice and snug on the headrest, it's extra wide, scratch resistant, nice and clear. My absolute must have with the rear view mirror was being able to position it as needed. This is possible with this mirror. It can rotate as you need it, making it perfect to get the right position to see baby. I give these as shower gifts and have one for myself. Highly recommend!!
customer_reviews.author: Janygirl

customer_reviews.title: My 3rd and FINAL baby mirror purchase. More expensive ...
customer_reviews.text: My 3rd and FINAL baby mirror purchase. More expensive than some, but definitely worth the cost. I have been through 2 other mirrors from brica -- one that cracked from a light tap, and the other that kept losing suction and swivel which either swiveled out of place annoyingly every 3 days or fell onto my baby. Finally a mirror which is secure, big enough to see my baby and my baby me, and one that won't falter! FINALLY!
customer_reviews.author: cdwk

customer_reviews.title: While the pivot is great the angle of the head rest prevented it from ...
customer_reviews.text: Product was as described. I had to get creative when the car seat is in the middle seat of a Jeep Grand Cherokee and using the mirror on the middle seat head rest. While the pivot is great the angle of the head rest prevented it from looking all the way down. I was able to rotate the mirror horizontal and "tuck" it in by extending the head rest and then closing the head rest with the mirror in between. Works well once situated. Would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan C.

customer_reviews.title: Strap broke after 4 months
customer_reviews.text: This mirror is very poor quality. I had it in my car for 4 months and suddenly the strap broke. The mirror is in the back seat of a sedan, so there is nothing rubbing it or placed near it that would cause the strap to fray. My son is only 5 months old and cannot reach the mirror. I am the onluy person who drives my car and I have not touched the mirror except to install it. I had to duct tape it to continue using it. I would have given it 5 stars before this happened, but I would expect to use this product longer than 4 months.
customer_reviews.author: Erin Lowrey

customer_reviews.title: Vibrates and tilts down after a few short trips
customer_reviews.text: Great mirror quality and size. However, it vibrates so much that it makes it very hard to look at. Also, the mirror (maybe from the vibrations) slowly starts to tilt down over the course of a few trips so that i have to adjust it often. It's strapped on the headrest pretty darned tightly, so i don't know what else to do to keep it form vibrating and tilting.
customer_reviews.author: tam i am

customer_reviews.title: Worth the extra money
customer_reviews.text: This mirror is so much better than the flat ones without the pivot. My husband has one of the others in his vehicle, and it is ridiculously difficult to get it strapped on so that we can actually see our child in it. This one, however, you just tighten on the headrest and pivot wherever you need it to go. It took less than two minutes to get it perfect. I keep telling my husband that we should just get him one of these, too, but he's stubborn.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: No central back seat headrest required!
customer_reviews.text: I have a 1999 GMC Jimmy without a head rest on the center seat in the back of the car. This mirror fulfilled my need for for a mirror that could not be mounted on the back of my center seat. Over all, I can see my child from the rear view mirror, if I stretch my head up. It's not ideal, but it's sure better than nothing. The mirror buckles onto the side headrest firmly and can be tightened. As you probably would guess, it does make it difficult for passengers to ride in the seat with the mirror attached to the headrest.
customer_reviews.author: fantasyteacherreader

customer_reviews.title: This one actually let's you see baby!
customer_reviews.text: Our last baby was never visible in hers but this one works great. It does move on washboard gravel roads but my older kids are able to adjust it easily and it holds its spot well every other trip. I tried clipping the straps like an X for some reason instead of a + and it slipped off the headrest like bra straps off your shoulder. So don't do it like I did at first and you'll be set.
customer_reviews.author: homeschoolmom5Top Contributor: Baby

customer_reviews.title: We've Tried Them All - This Is The Best
customer_reviews.text: I feel like we tried every back seat mirror before finally finding one that works. All of the other mirrors would eventually - in 2 miles or 200 - shake lose so they were no longer viweing the car seat. The ohter models use the straps as the adjustment which just leads to the frustration of attatching and tightening it over and over. This one has a much better design where the mirror can be aimed AFTER attatching it to the headreast with straps. And even though it is adjustable it is rigid enough that it never loosens.
customer_reviews.author: Rob Prindle

customer_reviews.title: Great rear-facing mirror!
customer_reviews.text: Great mirror to be able to watch your rear-facing kiddo. Large, easy to install. The mirror itself is wider than the pictures look. You must have back seats with headrests on them, however. We found this out trying to put it in the Saturn, which does not. So, it looks great in my Hyundai ;) I would definitely recommend this to any parent!!
customer_reviews.author: Melissa

customer_reviews.title: ... while you are driving and still think its a great idea, my daughter in law was worried that ...
customer_reviews.text: Although I was thrilled with this idea of being able to see the baby while you are driving and still think its a great idea, my daughter in law was worried that if there was a car accident it could shatter. We still plan on using it. And I just read that it is shatter proof, so that should alleviate any fears.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Tried a couple of mirrors at Baby's R Us and ...
customer_reviews.text: Tried a couple of mirrors at Baby's R Us and had to take them back. Atraches securely, only wish they made a smaller mirror for compact cars. Update: After 2-3 months of use the strap just broke when tightening it one day. Unfortunately busy being a new parent I didn't get around to returning it in time to see if they would replace it. Liked it until the strap just broke.
customer_reviews.author: James Mitchell

customer_reviews.title: amazing product!
customer_reviews.text: My car doesn't have a middle headrest so I was looking for a big enough mirror that can attach to the right or left side of the seats and still provide a view of my daughter... The headrests on each side of the car are ingrown... I wouldn't have been able to attach any mirror from top to bottom only across... It took me forever! But I've finally found THE ONE that works! Lol I'm beyond excited and relieved to be able to see my daughter while I'm driving... Gives me less anxiety of what she's doing, if she's okay or not... Thank you for an awesome product!
customer_reviews.author: nataliep586

customer_reviews.title: Fabulous product. Good quality.
customer_reviews.text: Easy to adjust, especially as it's very large and you can get a clear view of the baby even if it's not perfectly angled. Be aware that this is intended to attach to a removable type of headrest. I have non-removable, non-adjustable headrests and it took a little maneuvering to make it stay in place but we were able to make it work just fine. It's easy to accidentally bump into it and knock it out of alignment but you just have to check it after you buckle baby in.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan Beauchamp

customer_reviews.title: Good mirror, but comes lose easily.
customer_reviews.text: Easy to install, works great initially. After few bumpy rides, the straps need to be tightened again. The first time it came lose, I was scared it'd fall onto the car seat and injure my son, but luckily there are two straps that kind of just hang on the head rest. I need another one for my husband's car, but not getting this one again. Also I never received the bonus gifts.
customer_reviews.author: Bhumika P.

customer_reviews.title: Stress relief when driving
customer_reviews.text: This mirror is easy to use and large enough so that I can see my baby and part of the car seat from my rear view mirror. I have my car seat in the middle and the mirror on the top of the left back seat. I just angled it in a way so it works. Relieves stress.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Nice and large mirror, sturdy, stays put
customer_reviews.text: I really like this mirror. It installs easily and quickly. It is nice and large - so I can see both of my newborn twins in the backseat. I've had another backseat mirror for my toddler that was continually getting knocked loose and falling down. This mirror firmly attached to the headrest and has the ability to pivot any direction, and it stays put wherever you position it. I seriously wondered if spending more on this mirror vs. other cheaper ones was worth it. It definitely is!
customer_reviews.author: GolfersWife

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful mirror, suggested security improvement
customer_reviews.text: I love it (best looking mirror, best quality image from all that I tested). While the description is not very clear, this is also not a flat mirror but a convex one (meaning it shows a smaller image). I was somewhat concerned about the lack of crash testing and the solidity of the construction. But I modified it by securely attaching it to the headrest with lots of thick industrial strength Velcro tape:  (inspired by the design of one of the crash tested Brica mirrors).
customer_reviews.author: Uhu

customer_reviews.title: Good mirror, bad straps
customer_reviews.text: I really like this mirror, my problem is with the straps that secure it to the headrest. They are hard to adjust once you secure them to the headrest. I wish you could just pull them tight easily to secure the best fit. It is so hard to pull them tight. I had to resort to tying a knot to get a snug fit, that wouldn't loosen. It still loosens, unfortunately. I do like the mirror though, nice and clear.
customer_reviews.author: Natty

customer_reviews.title: Very clear reflection
customer_reviews.text: This is the nicest and easiest to use mirror I have ever seen, wish I would of had it with my first. So easy to position and it stays where you put it. I can see baby, baby can see me and the relecftion is perfect! Definitley reccomend to all new mommies, better then any mirror I have found in stores for sure!
customer_reviews.author: Krysten Elias

customer_reviews.title: Great product, wish I had bought it first!
customer_reviews.text: I chose to wait to post a review because they kept hounding me for one. In truth it is a great product and makes all other mirrors I've tried look cheap. This mirror is large but stays in place well. I can see my son in his rear facing car seat without issue. I would recommend it to all mothers looking for one. I drive a Pontiac Torrent that has irregular headrests on the back seat and this mirror secured well to it.
customer_reviews.author: Deborah L. Barber

customer_reviews.title: I got the worst anxiety! I immediately knew I had to get ...
customer_reviews.text: As a new mom, after driving by myself with baby and hearing her cry in the backseat, I got the worst anxiety! I immediately knew I had to get a mirror for piece of mind. This mirror does not disappoint. It is a very nice size and hooks onto the seat so easily. It is easily adjustable as well. I am so glad I bought this mirror and I know my baby is too. She enjoys looking at it, and when she gets older and bigger I'm pretty sure she will enjoy being able to see herself too!
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Great large mirror!
customer_reviews.text: A definite must have for new mommas! I used to get so worried driving and wondering if baby was okay...especially when she's too quiet. This mirror is a life changer. The mirror is huge. And it is very easy to attach to the headrest. I have the baby in a rear facing car seat in the middle and the mirror attached to a side seat head rest. Mirror can tilt up and down and side to side. Love it!
customer_reviews.author: ApplesandpaintTop Contributor: Baby

customer_reviews.title: Great big clear mirror--BUY IT
customer_reviews.text: The Best mirror! I had another cheapy mirror in my car, and ordered the scooterbug because it really is great to be able to see your baby clearly when driving. I bought this mirrors due to all the great reviews and sure enough, it is the best mirror ever. It attaches around the head rest in 2 directions, and the mirror doesn't move at al when drivigl, even driving on gravel bumpy roads here in vermont! You should buy this mirror.
customer_reviews.author: kmcg

customer_reviews.title: Don't leave in the heat
customer_reviews.text: This mirror was great until we moved to where the parking is not covered. The swivel part starting not staying put, I'm guessing from being in the sun. It gets 100-110 where we live so I'm guessing the heat ruined it. I ordered another - it's a bit different than the original, but it hasn't warped yet so maybe they made it better
customer_reviews.author: alli12987

customer_reviews.title: it's great! After the initial installation
customer_reviews.text: With the mirror I got at my baby shower, while it was cute and all, it was a constant pain. I was having to adjust it almost everytime we got in the car so I could see my baby, it never stayed put. I have not had to adjust this once, it's great! After the initial installation, which was simple, it's huge and regardless of any little bumps out of place, I can still her her. I bought a 2nd one for my husband's car.
customer_reviews.author: BB L.

customer_reviews.title: When I am driving I can easily see my whole entire baby sitting in his carseat
customer_reviews.text: I bought and tested about 5 backseat mirrors that strap onto the back seat headrest....NONE of them really worked until I found this one!!! It straps onto the headrest very sturdily and can be tilted any direction with ease. When I am driving I can easily see my whole entire baby sitting in his carseat. Very clear! I am purchasing another one for our 2nd car and one for grandmas car!! I highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Midwest MamaTop Contributor: Baby

customer_reviews.title: Large and has a slight convex bend for a much needed bird's eye view! LOVE IT
customer_reviews.text: this mirror has a slight convex bend so it gives a little bird's eye look which helps a lot when the mirror is kicked a little out of alignment. it has a wide view. LOVE IT! So does my 1 year old son because now he can see the dvd movies playing in the headrests behind him :) This was better than I expected. One of those pleasantly surprised purchases.
customer_reviews.author: Dalas B.

customer_reviews.title: I like the mirror because it allows me to see my ...
customer_reviews.text: Product came on time and is as advertised. I like the mirror because it allows me to see my baby while I am driving.
